title: Help With Extracting Data From A List Of Products (USPTO) - New Hire - 19/11/2017 02:25 EST
desc: Hi,We are looking for someone who can help us go through a long list of products and verify their status on USPTO. We work with products that are print on demand and need to ensure that our product titles do not infringe on trademark.Due to the number or products we have, it will be necessary to find someone confident who can perform this task for us on a monthly or bi-monthly basis.This is a very simple task that really only requires your attention to detail and ability to copy and paste data into a list. Basically you would go through our list of products title by title and verify if the title is on USPTO. If it is, you will add the title of our product to your list. If it's not on the USPTO website then you can leave it alone.Once you have completed analyzing the data and creating your list of titles that have shown up on USPTO, your job is done.Some product titles may be long and we will need you to break up the title into smaller and more common phrases to search for individually. For example if my product title is "John Went Across The Street For Pizza Last Week". When you check USPTO, you need to do separate searches for "John Went" "Across The Street" "For Pizza" & "Last Week". Also, for common or popular nouns, we will need you to search those individually. Since the list will be longer with those words/nouns we will provide you with a tool to make it easier. Common words in the example above include "Street" & "Pizza".The number pf products we have is approx 1800. That number is going up and down daily but there are MANY duplicates. Out of 1800 listings there are probably only 600 different titles you will need to search.If you have experience using USPTO ([url removed, login to view]) this will greatly benefit you over any other proposal. If not, no problem, it's not hard to figure out. If everything works out with this job we will train you on a tool that will make this a lot easier. Although, knowing how the USPTO website works first is important.There is no rush on the job however if you can finish properly in 48 hours we will provide a $30 bonus. (Job Needs To Be Done Properly!)If you have any questions, feel free to ask. Otherwise happy bidding!*Please type #NOV17 somewhere in your message so we know you read and understand everything in this posting. If you have #NOV17 in your message we will assume you completely understand what we have asked for above. If you don't understand please ask.*No milestones over 50% will be accepted. What this means is we will not create a full milestone once accepted. Only half will be created max.PS - If you know how to search trademarks accurately using this website and can prove it. I will hire you over anyone else. [url removed, login to view]

title: readers corner
desc: I am a Canadian and have spent more than ten years in China as a senior IT consultant working for multinationals. In the last two years I have started an English Language training school for kids 4-12. It has been very successful so far and is expanding very quickly. I have been prototyping my offering using various off the shelf tools up til now. But I want to start to develop my IT platform in more detail. The first component will be a Reading App (for Android & IPhone) that supports a dialogue between teachers and students either in real-time or in batch mode using sound or video clips. We have been using WeChat for this so far, but it doesn't keep sound, video files long enough. And we want to be able to re-use them.In our app, the teacher will read one of the story books in the app library and broadcast it to the class. Each student will respond by sending their own reading of the story to the teacher. They may want to send this in a video that their parents take on the phone, or an audio file. The teacher will then respond to their reading with a set of corrections to pronunciation of words or phrases. These are usually sound clips. Responding sound clips with correct pronunciations for each word or phrase in the story can be stored and reused for any student as well as to groups of students. This reduces the teaching effort.This is the core of the project. Later we will have other components to add to it. This is a priority at the moment.

desc: ABOUT THE PROJECTFor a health Company, we need to build a native application with a custom design (can be adapted from material design in Android) for iOS (iPhone only) and Android .This pages/views have to get information from a REST services (we are going to give you all document related to the REST services) and connect it the information in the UI.We have a login and recovery password, and all internal pages have access to information logged in.This is for a Company in Spanish language. So, we are going to give you all static text in Spanish, the other texts you get from the REST services (You don't need to worry about this, just implement it).We accept suggestion how make the best way to integrate language to the application.We use charset UTF-8.MODULES LIST1.	Login2.	Assigned team (Mi Equipo ACHS)3.	Worker information (Información del trabajador)4.	Certs (Certificados)5.	Membership (Afiliación) (Download PDF)6.	Company Quotation (Cotizacion empresa) (Download PDF)7.	Rates (Tasas)8.	Evaluation (Evaluaciones)9.	Worker Quotation (Cotizacion trabajador)10.	Validator (Validador)11.	Subsidies (Subsidios)13.	Support (Soporte)14.	Attention Centers (Centro de atención)15.	Benefits (Beneficios)16.	Accident Procedures (Procedimientos Accidentes)17.	FAQ (Preguntas Frecuentes)18.	Contact (Contáctanos)This is the wireframe with navigation: [url removed, login to view]Phase 1:We need build all static views with the custom design (made in sketch) until 2017-11-29 (Wednesday)Phase 2:Read data from REST services and deploy information into views for 2017-12-15 (Friday)We need a native application for both platforms (Android / iOS) and we accept builds in React Native, Xamarin, or Android Java / iOS Swift (prefered)

title: Porting of Cocos2d Class to iOS SpriteKit

I prefer Objective-C, but Swift is also OK if neccessary.You can find the original class and Cocos2d project by simply googling "ShatteredSprite cocos2d". Shattering effect should be customizable as the original file. Also shattering should be similar to the one shown in video and be random. I want the job done in a week.I want to emphasise that shattering should be done programmatically, I am not interested in png sequences created in After effects of some other animation program.

Feel free to use opensource or preexisting code, since this isn't a commercial application.Here is a short description of what I want:On the activity is present a map of Europe (probably as image, but its up to you) and there is a starting and ending point (for example: start in Spain, end in Russia). The names of the countries along the path will be written correctly or incorrectly and the user should advance through the map by clicking those with correct spelling. An image of a boy is standing on the beginning point and moving along with the progress (the image can be static and just transitioning between positions).I will give you the graphics needed for the game.

title: Mobile App developer Appcelerator
desc: We need a mobile app developer (iPhone and Android) for an established Drupal 7 subscription service. The product is downloadable audio (MP3) files similar to podcasts. We refer to the product as podcasts in this job description.You must be skilled in Javascript with extensive experience in Appcelerator Titanium and the Alloy framework. We prefer a Titanium-Certified Developer.Skills needed:- JavaScript- Appcelerator Titanium Alloy framework- Basic knowledge of Drupal 7 services- Git- App layout and designOur business is built on a recurring subscription model. The app must support an established subscription sign-up process for Android. The Apple App Store version must support signup through the App Store with a subscription product billed through AppleThe first version of the app will:- Support user login/authentication- User account management (password & other attributes attached to the User entity)- Send notifications (SMS & Email) when new podcast is loaded- Let the user search for podcasts from a library- Suggest podcasts that fit user criteria- Allow user to submit comments on podcast- Allow users to favorite a podcast- Allow users to download podcasts and store on mobile device for later use within the app- Serve up the next podcast (netflix style)- Prompt the user to share on social media - Facebook and TwitterTechnical considerations: Drupal 7 serves as the backend with REST endpoints created and managed by our technical lead. An NDA will be required. Graphics for the app will be provided by our designer; text for the app will be provided by our writer.This description outlines the minimum viable product for a first release of features. Additional features will be packaged into subsequent releases.Please respond with a link to a mobile app you helped develop.-

title: Arduino code and android app
desc: I need the code and android app for the following project. The Arduino board will be an Uno Rev 3 I need code to drive a stepper motor that must use the Accelstepper.h  library and the SoftwareSerial.h library as the project is to be used via Bluetooth. I need the speed, acceleration and amount of rotation to bounce from a defined limit in the app and back again. The speed, acceleration and amount of rotation need to be controlled via three separate sliders on the app. The app must be made in MITapp inventer for us to style it and tweak it.Also, need a Bluetooth connection button in the app and a emergency stop button.This is a very easy job for someone who understands Arduino and C++here is the base code for the Arduino that currently works but only directly run from the board.<code>// [url removed, login to view]// -*- mode: C++ -*-// Runs one stepper forwards and backwards, accelerating and decelerating// at the limits.//#include <AccelStepper.h>// Define some steppers and the pins the will useAccelStepper stepper1; // Defaults to AccelStepper::FULL4WIRE (4 pins) on 2, 3, 4, 5void setup(){[url removed, login to view](200.0);[url removed, login to view](100.0);[url removed, login to view](24);}void loop(){// Change direction at the limitsif ([url removed, login to view]() == 0)[url removed, login to view]([url removed, login to view]());[url removed, login to view]();[url removed, login to view]();[url removed, login to view]();}<code/>Need this code to run via android Bluetooth with adjustable sliders for each MaxSpeed, Acceleration and moveTo

title: Help me get everything working on my Nginx server on my raspbery pi
desc: I am trying to get my raspberry pi to act as a server for the database and datatransfer for our android app aswell as a simple php page as a admin panel, and want help with setting up everything correctly, currently we're in the stage where we can reach the standard index page from other computers on the network but the rest of the world cant.In the server we will need first of all to port forward it i assume, so the rest of the world can reach it, but also php, mysql db aswell a SQLite DB.Some info about the entire project: We have a search app where you search on streets that been using a local json file meaning every time we make a update everyone have to download the app once again. we have been remaking it so the main purpose of this server is to store data in a database so we can update the database on the server, then all users of the app will get fully updated sqlite db's pushed to them once every day or so. i belive the steps would be like MYSQL-> server SQlite -> local SQlite
